verses.verse: Then these<WH428> three<WH7969> men<WH376> ceased<WH7673> answering<WH6030> Job,<WH347> because<WH3588> he was righteous<WH6662> in his own eyes.<WH5869>

But the anger<WH639> of Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite,<WH940> of the family<WH4940> of Ram<WH7410> burned;<WH2734> against Job<WH347> his anger<WH639> burned,<WH2734> because<WH5921> he justified<WH6663> himself<WH5315> before<WH4480> God.<WH430>
And his anger<WH639> burned<WH2734> against his three<WH7969> friends<WH7453> because<WH5921> <WH834> they had found<WH4672> no<WH3808> answer,<WH4617> and yet had condemned<WH7561> Job.<WH347>
Now Elihu<WH453> had waited<WH2442> to speak<WH1697> to Job<WH347> because<WH3588> they were years<WH3117> older<WH2205> than<WH4480> he.
And when Elihu<WH453> saw<WH7200> that there<WH369> was no<WH369> answer<WH4617> in the mouth<WH6310> of the three<WH7969> men<WH376> his anger<WH639> burned.<WH2734>

So Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite<WH940> spoke<WH6030> out and said,<WH559> "I am young<WH6810> in years<WH3117> and you are old;<WH3453> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> I was shy<WH2119> and afraid<WH3372> to tell<WH2331> you what<WH1843> I think.<WH1843>
"I thought<WH559> age<WH3117> should speak,<WH1696> And increased<WH7230> years<WH8141> should teach<WH3045> wisdom.<WH2451>
"But it is a spirit<WH7307> in man,<WH582> And the breath<WH5397> of the Almighty<WH7706> gives<WH995> them understanding.<WH995>
"The abundant<WH7227> [in years] may not be wise,<WH2449> Nor<WH3808> may elders<WH2205> understand<WH995> justice.<WH4941>
"So<WH3651> I say,<WH559> 'Listen<WH8085> to me, I too<WH637> will tell<WH2331> what<WH1843> I think.<WH1843>'
"Behold,<WH2005> I waited<WH3176> for your words,<WH1697> I listened<WH238> to your reasonings,<WH8394> While<WH5704> you pondered<WH2713> what<WH4405> to say.<WH4405>
"I even paid<WH995> close<WH995> attention<WH995> to you, Indeed,<WH2009> there<WH369> was no<WH369> one<WH369> who refuted<WH3198> Job,<WH347> Not one of you who answered<WH6030> his words.<WH561>
"Do not say,<WH559> 'We have found<WH4672> wisdom;<WH2451> God<WH410> will rout<WH5086> him, not man.<WH376>'
"For he has not arranged<WH6186> [his] words<WH4405> against<WH413> me; Nor<WH3808> will I reply<WH7725> to him with your arguments.<WH561>
"They are dismayed,<WH2865> they answer<WH6030> no<WH3808> more;<WH5750> Words<WH4405> have failed<WH6275> them.
"And shall I wait,<WH3176> because<WH3588> they do not speak,<WH1696> Because<WH3588> they stop<WH5975> [and] answer<WH6030> no<WH3808> more<WH5750>?
"I too<WH637> will answer<WH6030> my share,<WH2506> I also<WH637> will tell<WH2331> my opinion.<WH1843>
"For I am full<WH4390> of words;<WH4405> The spirit<WH7307> within<WH990> me constrains<WH6693> me.
"Behold,<WH2009> my belly<WH990> is like unvented<WH3808> <WH6605> wine,<WH3196> Like new<WH2319> wineskins<WH178> it is about to burst.<WH1234>
"Let me speak<WH1696> that I may get<WH7304> relief;<WH7304> Let me open<WH6605> my lips<WH8193> and answer.<WH6030>
"Let me now<WH4994> be partial<WH5375> <WH6440> to no<WH408> one;<WH376> Nor<WH3808> flatter<WH3655> [any] man.<WH120>
"For I do not know<WH3045> how to flatter,<WH3655> [Else] my Maker<WH6213> would soon<WH4592> take<WH5375> me away.
